WorkItem.Summary: [Hunter] Cannot Import Data from Battle.net or Addon

Comments.Message:
Duplicate, already fixed



** Closed by Jothay 4/15/2011 2:50 PM

This problem is NOT fixed.  Yes, there was a similar problem several weeks ago related to the server returning bad data.  This is a completely different set of errors (about six screens of them, in fact).  Here is the second of the error messages:

   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentException(ExceptionResource resource)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.CalculateTriggers(Character character, CharacterCalculationsHunter calculatedStats, Stats statsTotal, CalculationOptionsHunter calcOpts, BossOptions bossOpts, Dictionary`2 triggerIntervals, Dictionary`2 triggerChances)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.GetCharacterStats(Character character, Item additionalItem)

Here is the third:

  at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentException(ExceptionResource resource)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.CalculateTriggers(Character character, CharacterCalculationsHunter calculatedStats, Stats statsTotal, CalculationOptionsHunter calcOpts, BossOptions bossOpts, Dictionary`2 triggerIntervals, Dictionary`2 triggerChances)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.GetCharacterStats(Character character, Item additionalItem)

Here is the fourth:

   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentException(ExceptionResource resource)
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.Insert(TKey key, TValue value, Boolean add)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.CalculateTriggers(Character character, CharacterCalculationsHunter calculatedStats, Stats statsTotal, CalculationOptionsHunter calcOpts, BossOptions bossOpts, Dictionary`2 triggerIntervals, Dictionary`2 triggerChances)
   at Rawr.Hunter.CalculationsHunter.GetCharacterStats(Character character, Item additionalItem)

Just a clarification for anyone:
When we say "fixed", we generally mean that this has been fixed for the NEXT release.  We do NOT mean that it has been fixed and that if you re-download Rawr, it will work.  You have to wait for us to release a new version.
Or you could download the source and compile it yourself if you are son inclined.

Don't be an arrogant ass, Jothay.  When your users take their time (which is likely much more valuable than yours, little boy), you should be grateful for their help.  No one was "pissy" with you, but you closed this issue without providing any information whatsoever.  Had you been mature enough to answer like Timetodance, there would have been no reason to reopen the issue.  Also, don't assume your users don't search before posting. . .I did and saw nothing remotely similar.  It's now obvious to me who wrote the unbelievably arrogant and ridiculous "rules" for posting and helping you with your incredibly buggy code.  Good luck in life with your attitude. . .you'll need it.
I think that if you reread this thread, you'll see that is is you, harristl, that is being the asshat.
